feed.title: Combined summary - BIP Proposal: Define Bitcoin Subunits as Satoshis/Sats

entry.title: Combined summary - BIP Proposal: Define Bitcoin Subunits as Satoshis/Sats
entry.summary:
The recent communication proposes an addition to the Bitcoin Improvement Proposal (BIP) focusing on the accessibility aspect of cryptocurrency terminology, specifically addressing the need for standardized pronunciation and guidance within assistive technologies. The suggestion emphasizes the importance of creating a more accessible interface for users with disabilities, drawing inspiration from Hal Finney's experiences. The enhancement aims to introduce guidelines on how terms related to Bitcoin, especially the smallest unit known as "satoshi," should be handled in screen readers, voice assistants, and other accessible interfaces. This proposal suggests clarifying the pronunciation for "one satoshi" to ensure consistency across various platforms.
Furthermore, the proposed BIP seeks to formalize the nomenclature for Bitcoin's smallest unit, advocating for "satoshi" as the singular term and "satoshis" for the plural, with "sats" as its abbreviation. This initiative stems from the observation that despite the widespread use of these terms within the Bitcoin community, there is no formal standardization, leading to discrepancies in their application across different mediums including software applications, documentation, and communications. The proposal highlights that this effort is distinct from previous proposals such as BIP-176, which introduced the "Bits Denomination," and BIP-177 that suggested redefining Bitcoin's base unit. Instead, it focuses solely on standardizing existing terminology without proposing changes to the denomination scheme.
The document available for review at [GitHub](https://deref-gmx.com/mail/client/rgLlibWjbIA/dereferrer/?redirectUrl=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fbitcoin%2Fbips%2Fpull%2F1841) outlines the details of the proposal and invites feedback from the community to refine and improve upon the initial suggestion. This call for community input underscores the proposer's commitment to achieving a consensus-driven approach to enhancing the Bitcoin protocol's accessibility and usability.
